com.fuse.utils

Class Event<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fuse.utils.Event<T>

  • public class Event<T>
extends Object
    Author:
    Mark van de Korput The Event class implements the Observer pattern in a reusable and safe way.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Event()
      Default constructor.

      Enables history recording

      Enables history recording
      void forward(Event<T> other)
      Registers this event as a listener to the specified event to forward the specified event's notifications to our own listeners
      List<T> getHistory()
      Returns the recorded list of values that have been triggered before
      boolean hasListener(Consumer<T> listener)
      The hasListener method informs the caller if a given Consumer instance is currently registered as listener of this event.
      boolean hasOwner(Object owner) 
      boolean isHistoryEnabled()
      Returns true if this event is currently recording it history (false by default)
      boolean isTriggering()
      Returns if the event is currently triggering (and thus iterating over it's listeners)
      void removeListener(Consumer<T> listener)
      Remove a specific listener by listener reference If this event is currently triggering (thus iterating over its listeners) the specified listener won't actually be removed until the current notifications have finished.
      void removeListeners(Object owner)
      Remove all listeners that were registered with the specified owner.
      int size()
      Returns the number of registered listeners

      Stop forwarding specific event that was being forwarded using .forward();

      Removes all callbacks registered using the whenTriggered methods

      Removes all callbacks registered using the whenTriggered for this specific owner

      Start notification of all registered listeners with the given payload
      void whenTriggered(Runnable func)
      Calls whenTriggered with the given runnable and the default null owner, see whenTriggered(Runnable, Object)
      void whenTriggered(Runnable func, Object owner)
      Register parameter-less callback (Runnable instance) that gets invoked every time this event is triggered, just like "normal" listeners, but without parameters
      void withAllValues(Consumer<T> func)
      Runs the given logic for all values that are recorded into the internal history (if enabled) and also registers the logic like a "normal" listener.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Event

        public Event()
        Default constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public void addListener(Consumer<T> newListener)
        Registers a new listener with default null owner. If this event is currently triggering (thus iterating over its listeners) the specified listener won't actually be registered until the current notifications have finished.
        Parameters:
        newListener - reference to the listener that should be registered

      • addListener

        public void addListener(Consumer<T> newListener,
                        Object owner)
        Register a new listener. If this event is currently triggering (thus iterating over its listeners) the specified listener won't actually be registered until the current notifications have finished.
        Parameters:
        newListener - reference to the listener that should be registered
        owner - owner of the new listener

      • addOnceListener

        public void addOnceListener(Consumer<T> newListener)

      • addOnceListener

        public void addOnceListener(Consumer<T> newListener,
                            Object owner)
        Add listener that should be called only once (for the first upcoming notification). The listener is removed immediately after the first notification. If this event is currently triggering (thus iterating over its listeners) the specified listener won't actually be registered until the current notifications have finished.
        Parameters:
        newListener - reference to the listener that should be registered
        owner - owner of the new listener

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(Consumer<T> listener)
        Remove a specific listener by listener reference If this event is currently triggering (thus iterating over its listeners) the specified listener won't actually be removed until the current notifications have finished.
        Parameters:
        listener - reference to the actual listener that should be removed

      • removeListeners

        public void removeListeners(Object owner)
        Remove all listeners that were registered with the specified owner. If this event is currently triggering (thus iterating over its listeners) the specified listeners won't actually be removed until the current notifications have finished.
        Parameters:
        owner - owner of the listeners that should be removed

      • trigger

        public void trigger(T arg)
        Start notification of all registered listeners with the given payload
        Parameters:
        arg - the payload to give to all listeners

      • isTriggering

        public boolean isTriggering()
        Returns if the event is currently triggering (and thus iterating over it's listeners)
        Returns:
        boolean

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of registered listeners
        Returns:
        int

      • forward

        public void forward(Event<T> other)
        Registers this event as a listener to the specified event to forward the specified event's notifications to our own listeners
        Parameters:
        other - source event who's notifications to forward to our own listeners

      • stopForwards

        public void stopForwards()
        Stop forwarding all events that were being forwarded using .forward();

      • stopForward

        public void stopForward(Event<T> other)
        Stop forwarding specific event that was being forwarded using .forward();
        Parameters:
        other - source event to stop forwarding

      • hasOwner

        public boolean hasOwner(Object owner)
        Parameters:
        owner - The owner for which to check
        Returns:
        boolean True if there are any listeners for the specified owner registered

      • hasListener

        public boolean hasListener(Consumer<T> listener)
        The hasListener method informs the caller if a given Consumer instance is currently registered as listener of this event.
        Parameters:
        listener - The owner for which to check
        Returns:
        boolean True if there are any listeners for the specified owner registered

      • getHistory

        public List<T> getHistory()
        Returns the recorded list of values that have been triggered before
        Returns:
        List The recorded history of triggered values

      • enableHistory

        public void enableHistory()
        Enables history recording

      • enableHistory

        public void enableHistory(boolean enable)
        Enables history recording
        Parameters:
        enable - When true; enables history recording, otherwise it disables history recording

      • isHistoryEnabled

        public boolean isHistoryEnabled()
        Returns true if this event is currently recording it history (false by default)
        Returns:
        boolean The current history-recording status

      • withAllValues

        public void withAllValues(Consumer<T> func)
        Runs the given logic for all values that are recorded into the internal history (if enabled) and also registers the logic like a "normal" listener.
        Parameters:
        func - The Listener which should also be invoked for all history values

      • whenTriggered

        public void whenTriggered(Runnable func)
        Calls whenTriggered with the given runnable and the default null owner, see whenTriggered(Runnable, Object)
        Parameters:
        func - The ownerless callback

      • whenTriggered

        public void whenTriggered(Runnable func,
                          Object owner)
        Register parameter-less callback (Runnable instance) that gets invoked every time this event is triggered, just like "normal" listeners, but without parameters
        Parameters:
        func - The listener to be invoked every time this even is triggered
        owner - The owner by which this listener can be removed using stopWhenTriggeredCallbacks

      • stopWhenTriggeredCallbacks

        public void stopWhenTriggeredCallbacks()
        Removes all callbacks registered using the whenTriggered methods

      • stopWhenTriggeredCallbacks

        public void stopWhenTriggeredCallbacks(Object owner)
        Removes all callbacks registered using the whenTriggered for this specific owner
